metadata.purpose: Define exceptions for central SSOT classes that can exceed standard module size limits
metadata.rationale: Some central classes serve as Single Source of Truth and must contain comprehensive functionality that cannot be meaningfully split without violating SSOT principles

exception_criteria.criterion: Must be a Single Source of Truth (SSOT) for its domain
Must serve as a central integration point for multiple services
Splitting would violate SSOT principles or create circular dependencies
Must be explicitly documented and justified in this file
Functions within mega classes can be up to 50 lines if they coordinate multiple operations

exception.justification: Central SSOT for all database operations across the platform. Contains unified interfaces for PostgreSQL, ClickHouse, and Redis. Splitting would require duplicate connection management and transaction handling.

requirements.requirement: Must maintain single connection pool per database type
Must provide unified transaction management
Must centralize all database configuration

exception.justification: Central WebSocket manager handling all real-time communications. Critical for chat functionality (90% of platform value). Contains WebSocket lifecycle, event routing, and agent integration. Splitting would break real-time event flow and create race conditions.

requirements.requirement: Must maintain single WebSocket connection per client
Must handle all agent event types in one place
Must provide centralized connection state management

exception.justification: Central test orchestration for entire platform. Must coordinate unit, integration, E2E, and mission-critical tests. Contains all test discovery, execution, and reporting logic. Splitting would fragment test configuration and reporting.

requirements.requirement: Must provide single entry point for all test types
Must maintain unified test configuration
Must generate consolidated test reports

exception.justification: Central deployment orchestrator for GCP. Contains all build, push, and deployment logic for multiple services. Must coordinate frontend, backend, auth service deployments. Splitting would risk deployment inconsistencies.

requirements.requirement: Must maintain atomic deployment transactions
Must provide rollback capability for all services
Must centralize all GCP configuration

exception.justification: SSOT for all lifecycle operations consolidating 100+ legacy managers. Central integration point for startup, shutdown, health monitoring. Critical for zero-downtime deployments and chat service reliability. Contains factory pattern for multi-user isolation and WebSocket coordination. Splitting would break lifecycle coordination and create race conditions.

requirements.requirement: Must handle all component lifecycle phases atomically
Must provide user-isolated lifecycle management
Must coordinate with WebSocket events for real-time notifications
Must maintain comprehensive health monitoring

exception.justification: SSOT for all configuration management consolidating 50+ config managers. Central configuration store with multi-source precedence and validation. Critical for eliminating configuration drift across environments. Contains service-specific configuration creation and IsolatedEnvironment integration. Splitting would fragment configuration consistency and validation.

requirements.requirement: Must use IsolatedEnvironment for all environment variable access
Must validate against MISSION_CRITICAL_NAMED_VALUES_INDEX
Must provide service-specific configuration methods
Must support multi-user configuration isolation

exception.justification: SSOT for all state management consolidating 50+ state managers. Central state store with scoped isolation and TTL-based expiration. Critical for agent state consistency and WebSocket synchronization. Contains multi-user state isolation and comprehensive querying capabilities. Splitting would break state consistency and create synchronization issues.

requirements.requirement: Must provide thread-safe state operations with fine-grained locking
Must support scoped state isolation (user, session, thread, agent)
Must integrate with WebSocket manager for real-time state sync
Must provide comprehensive state querying and filtering

candidate.rejection_reason: Not truly central - specific to ClickHouse operations only. Can be refactored to use database_manager.py as SSOT. Size is manageable with minor refactoring.
Frontend auth context should be lightweight. Complex logic should be in backend auth service. fetchAuthConfig function (166 lines) must be refactored.

refactoring_guidelines.guideline: Classes approaching 2000 lines must be reviewed quarterly for potential refactoring.
New additions to mega classes must be justified in pull requests.
Functions within mega classes should still aim for <25 lines where possible.
Mega classes must maintain internal organization with clear sections and documentation.
Consider using composition or delegation patterns before expanding mega classes.

compliance_notes.note: Files exceeding 2000 lines are NOT eligible for mega class exception and MUST be refactored.
This exception list must be reviewed and approved by Principal Engineer role.
New exceptions require explicit BVJ (Business Value Justification).
Mega classes must have dedicated integration tests validating SSOT behavior.

improvement.description: Business-focused naming to replace confusing "Manager" terminology

rename.rationale: Name directly reflects business function - this IS the platform's configuration system
Name directly reflects business function - this IS the application's state store
Name directly reflects business function - this IS the system's lifecycle controller
Emphasizes business value (real-time communications) over implementation (WebSocket)
Emphasizes what it provides (data access) rather than administrative function
